## Bugfix
Fix support of hot-reload of nested XAML dic

## What is the current behavior?
Only the root dic is reloaded

## What is the new behavior?
🙃

## Copilot Summary

<!-- This allows GitHub Copilot to provide a summary for your PR -->
<!-- Please do not touch the next line, it will be replaced with the generated summary -->
<!--
copilot:summary
-->
### <samp>🤖 Generated by Copilot at 16b2fff</samp>

This pull request enhances the hot reload feature for xaml resource dictionaries by changing the code generation and registration logic. comment.body: It's based on a trick where `public string TargetFrameworkVersion { get; set; } = "";` is the default, and that `TargetFrameworkVersion ` is not set when empty from msbuild. So it will never be set to null. It's also not marked as required because netstandard2.0 does not set this property.

issue.title: `TwoPaneView` has infinite height

labels.name: kind/bug
labels.description: Something isn't working

labels.name: triage/untriaged
labels.description: Indicates an issue requires triaging or verification

labels.name: project/layout 🧱
labels.description: Categorizes an issue or PR as relevant to layouting and containers (Measure/Arrange, Collections,..)

labels.name: difficulty/tbd
labels.description: Categorizes an issue for which the difficulty level needs to be defined.

issue.body:
### Current behavior

When using the `TwoPaneView` control with GridView I noticed my button that is supposed to be always visible is rendered on the bottom on Uno platforms which should not happen and this behavior differs from WinUI.

This is how it currently looks on Android, notice I had to scroll down to see the Button

![image](https://github.com/unoplatform/uno/assets/78549750/6cd8abbd-faae-4c57-8f58-c243000a6c31)


### Expected behavior

On Windows the Button is always visible on the screen

![image](https://github.com/unoplatform/uno/assets/78549750/90fed4a1-d386-4ab8-8c29-da2772948bcb)

### How to reproduce it (as minimally and precisely as possible)

https://github.com/morning4coffe-dev/uno-platform-testing/tree/doti/twopaneview-height

### Workaround

_No response_

### Works on UWP/WinUI

Yes

### Environment

Uno.UI / Uno.UI.WebAssembly / Uno.UI.Skia, Uno.WinUI / Uno.WinUI.WebAssembly / Uno.WinUI.Skia

### NuGet package version(s)

_No response_

### Affected platforms

WebAssembly, Android, iOS, macOS (AppKit), Mac Catalyst, Skia (WPF), Skia (GTK on Linux/macOS/Windows), Skia (Linux Framebuffer)

### IDE

_No response_

### IDE version

_No response_

### Relevant plugins

_No response_

### Anything else we need to know?

_No response_

comment.body: `ItemsWrapGrid` is actually not implemented on Skia.

issue.title: fix: Correcting handling of datacontext due to inheritance
issue.body:
## PR Type

What kind of change does this PR introduce?
- Bugfix

## What is the current behavior?

If the Frame has a DataContext set that is different from the page, when HR updates the UI it doesn't apply the old page DataContext, resulting in the Frame DataContext being inherited

## What is the new behavior?

Old page DataContext is applied

## Copilot Summary

<!-- This allows GitHub Copilot to provide a summary for your PR -->
<!-- Please do not touch the next line, it will be replaced with the generated summary -->
<!--
copilot:summary
-->
### <samp>🤖 Generated by Copilot at a09ca39</samp>

This pull request enhances the hot reload feature for XAML views by improving the data context management and adding new test cases. It modifies the file `ClientHotReloadProcessor.Xaml.cs` to avoid unnecessary data context updates, and adds a new record type `HR_Frame_VM` and a new test method `Check_Can_Change_Page1_With_Inherited_DataContext` to the files `Given_Frame_DataContext.cs` and `HR_Frame_Pages_Page1_VM.cs` respectively.

## PR Checklist

Please check if your PR fulfills the following requirements:

- [ ] Docs have been added/updated which fit [documentation template](https://github.com/unoplatform/uno/blob/master/doc/.feature-template.md) (for bug fixes / features)

issue.title: fix: Setting dispatcherqueue from current window
issue.body:
Fix following: https://github.com/unoplatform/uno/pull/14003

## PR Type

What kind of change does this PR introduce?
- Bugfix

## What is the current behavior?

DispatcherQueue not being picked up on non-winui targets

## What is the new behavior?

DispatcherQueue always picked up from the specified window

## Copilot Summary

<!-- This allows GitHub Copilot to provide a summary for your PR -->
<!-- Please do not touch the next line, it will be replaced with the generated summary -->
<!--
copilot:summary
-->
### <samp>🤖 Generated by Copilot at a2c8e7b</samp>

Simplify dispatcher queue retrieval in `ClientHotReloadProcessor.MetadataUpdate.cs` to fix hot reload on WinUI 3.0. Use `CurrentWindow?.DispatcherQueue` instead of `DispatcherQueue.GetForCurrentThread()` for all platforms.
